Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_neldvxAP4N1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><iframe frameborder="0" height="315" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/y3hW_5tDoDU" width="420"></iframe></p>

<p>This is Games with <a href="http://bit.ly/1qqtlys"><strong>HANK</strong></a> and this is Hank in Space. Hold on a minute - Hank as in Vlogbrothers Hank? Nerdfighteria Hank? Yep. That Hank. KSP came highly requested to him, so watch as Hank Green enters the cosmos in search of, well, you’ll see.</p>
That's very sad. Now I know why it was necessary for buildings to explode in the game.

I mostly know Hank from the Crash Course series, it's quite funny to watch him playing one of my favorite games of all time.

". . . Can it land this giant booster? No it can't! But my Kerbals lived!"

I like how it's titled "Part 1"...

Yeah I know him from the crash course series too. A good set of brothers those two are.

Why can't I put this there?!?

Also, using no liquid fuel in a liquid fuel engine...
Not the worst kind of exposure for KSP! Also shows how much fun stupid contraptions can be.
It was ... entertaining, but, can't help thinking the "ignorance" of game play was somewhat contrived.
